intro: Cedrela pachyrhachis, commonly known as the thick-ribbed cedrela, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves and distinctive, often fragrant flowers. Its wood is highly prized for its strength and fine grain, though it is also used in traditional medicine. Cedrela pachyrhachis plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
